answers.answer: Since yesterday my symptoms have kind of changed a but.  I know have general sensitivity on the outside skin of my penis, as well as general dull ache in the surrounding area added to my other symptoms.  (Constant sting/burn in the tip of my penis and a feeling of tiny drops of pee leaking out with no actual liquid apearing)Still no discharge, no discoloration, no bumps, no rash, no abdominal pain, no fever of any kind, no pain on urination whatsoever.  I had a UI done with no negative implicatins and blood work showed high glucose levels and they are testing for diabetes.  I doubt it could be diabetes and am afraid it t could be an STD... but I cannot find any STD's that meet my symptoms.  I have not had sex in over 11 weeks and my symptoms are fewer than 2-3 weeks old.I have looked up every STD and

question: For almost three weeks now I have had constant burning at the tip of my penis.  It is not intensified when I urinate, in fact it is somewhat relieved during urination but intensified immediately afterwards.  The pain does not go away, and I feel like it gets worse as the day goes on.  I have to take Tylenol before I will be able to fall asleep.The fact that it is constant, and not during urination leads me away from thinking it is Chlamydia and Ghonoria... I went in and had UI done which came up negative and my blood tests showed high glucose so the doctor thinks there might be some diabetes like problem.  Could this be possible?The last time I had sex was over 3 months and two weeks ago and the symptoms only started recently.This is my only symptom other than slight tenderness/redness that occurred on skin between my thigh and testicles after I trimmed my hair down.  This was due (I think) to lots of walking and sweating outside and friction.  The redness has gone away, but the slight sensitivity seems to have stuck around.  It was not a lesion or any kind, only darkened skin.Thanks in advance.../Freaking out...
title: Could it be?
